intro: Vicatia atrosanguinea, commonly known as the black blood vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dark, almost black stems and leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink, often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually opposite, simple, and have a leathery texture. Vicatia atrosanguinea is valued in traditional medicine for its purported medicinal properties.
